SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

javax.batch.annotation
Annotation Type Job

@Target(value=TYPE)
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface Job

Use the @Job annotation to define a job implementation. The @Job annotation is specified on a class declaration. The required name attribute specifies the logical name of the job implementation. This name is used to reference the job through the batch container operations interface. The optional executionOrder attribute specifies the order in which the job steps are to execute. It is required if the job has more than one step. The optional options attribute may be specified to exploit unique features provided by batch container plug-in implementations.

Required Element Summary
 java.lang.String name
          Specifies required job name.
 
Optional Element Summary
 java.lang.String[] executionOrder
          Specifies order in which steps execute.
 java.lang.String options
          Specifies optional options string.
 

Element Detail

name

public abstract java.lang.String name
Specifies required job name.

options

public abstract java.lang.String options
Specifies optional options string.

Default:
""

executionOrder

public abstract java.lang.String[] executionOrder
Specifies order in which steps execute. This attribute is required for a job that has more than one step.

Default:
{}
